text: Babylon’s Idols
Bel bows down;
Nebo \add is\add* stooping.
Their idols are ⸤on⸥\f + \fr 46:1 \ft Literally “to” \f* animals\f + \fr 46:1 \ft Hebrew “animal” \f* and ⸤on⸥\f + \fr 46:1 \ft Literally “to” \f* cattle;
your ⸤cargo⸥\f + \fr 46:1 \ft Literally “things that are carried” \f* is carried \add as\add* a burden ⸤on⸥\f + \fr 46:1 \ft Literally “to” \f* weary \add animals\add*.
They stoop;
they bow down together.
They are not able to save \add the\add* burden,
but\f + \fr 46:2 \ft Or “and” \f* ⸤they themselves go⸥\f + \fr 46:2 \ft Literally “their inner self goes” \f* in captivity.
“Listen to me, house of Jacob,
and all the remnant of the house of Israel
who have been carried from \add the\add* belly,
who have been carried from \add the\add* womb:
Even\f + \fr 46:4 \ft Or “And” \f* to \add your\add* old age I \add am\add* he;
even\f + \fr 46:4 \ft Or “And” \f* to \add your\add* advanced age I myself will support \add you\add*.
I myself have made \add you\add*,
and I myself will carry \add you\add*,
and I myself will support \add you\add*,
and I will save \add you\add*.
To whom will you liken me,
and count as equal,
and compare with me,
as though\f + \fr 46:5 \ft Or “and” \f* we were alike?
Those who lavish gold from \add the\add* purse
and weigh out silver in the balance scales;
hire ⸤a goldsmith⸥\f + \fr 46:6 \ft Literally “one who smelts” \f*
and he makes him a god;
they bow down,
indeed they bow in worship.
They carry it on \add their\add* shoulder;
they support it and they set it \add in\add* its place,
and it stands in position.
It cannot be removed from its place;
even \add when\add* he cries out to it, it does not answer.
It does not save him from his trouble.
Remember this and pluck up courage!
Call to ⸤mind⸥,\f + \fr 46:8 \ft Literally “heart” \f* \add you\add* transgressors!
Remember \add the\add* former things from ⸤a long time ago⸥,\f + \fr 46:9 \ft Literally “forever” \f*
for I \add am\add* God and there is none besides \add me\add*,
God and \add there is\add* none like me,
who from \add the\add* beginning declares \add the\add* end,
and from before, \add things\add* that have not been done,
who says, ‘My plan shall stand,’
and, ‘I will accomplish\f + \fr 46:10 \ft Or “do” \f* all my wishes,’\f + \fr 46:10 \ft Hebrew “wish” \f*
who calls a bird of prey from \add the\add* east,
the man of his\f + \fr 46:11 \ft The reading tradition (\fqa Qere \ft ) has “my” \f* plan from a country from afar.
Indeed I have spoken; indeed I will bring it \add to being\add*.
I have formed \add it\add*; indeed I will do it.
Listen to me, strong of heart,
far from righteousness!
I bring my righteousness near; \add it is\add* not far.
And my salvation will not delay;
and I will put\f + \fr 46:13 \ft Or “give” \f* salvation in Zion,
for Israel my glory.”
